usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script uses PrEntity to select ElementWallSF objects and interacts directly with Beam entities. There is no usage of 'sd_' prefixes, Viewport entities, or #Type E declarations with _Entity arrays, which would indicate Paper Space or Shop Drawing environments. The script performs a modification operation and then calls eraseInstance(), which is typical behavior for a utility script executed in Model Space.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: Model space containing ElementWallSF elements (Wall elements) constructed with beams.
requiredSettings: Extrusion profile catalog entry defined by property sProfile

scriptPurpose.summary: Selectively converts standard rectangular studs in timber walls to custom 3D extrusion profiles (e.g., I-Joists), with filters for wall type, stud function (plates, cripples, jacks), and beam codes.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Converting standard wall framing to engineered timber profiles (like I-joists) for specific wall sections, while retaining standard solid timber for plates, openings, and boundary members.

parameters.name: sProfile
parameters.businessMeaning: The name of the 3D extrusion profile (e.g., an I-joist shape) from the catalog to apply to the selected beams.
parameters.validRange: Any existing entry in the Extrusion Profile catalog.
parameters.affectsOutput: Replaces the beam's cross-sectional geometry with the selected profile shape.

parameters.name: psExtType
parameters.businessMeaning: The codes of the Wall Elements (ElementWallSF) to process. Only walls with these codes will be affected.
parameters.affectsOutput: Limits the script's scope to only walls matching these specific codes.

parameters.name: sMes1
parameters.businessMeaning: A read-only label acting as a visual separator in the properties list.

parameters.name: sTopPlate
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes the top plates (and angled top plates) from being converted to the profile.
parameters.affectsOutput: Top plates retain their standard rectangular solid timber geometry.

parameters.name: sBottomPlate
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes the bottom plates from being converted to the profile.
parameters.affectsOutput: Bottom plates retain their standard rectangular solid timber geometry.

parameters.name: sBlocking
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes blocking members (short stiffeners between studs) from conversion.

parameters.name: sAllOpBeams
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', acts as a master switch to exclude all beams associated with openings (cripples, jacks, kings, sills, headers, transoms, packers) from conversion.
parameters.affectsOutput: All opening framing members retain standard geometry, overriding specific opening parameters.

parameters.name: sCripple
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes the specific cripple stud immediately adjacent to the opening (left or right side) from conversion.
parameters.affectsOutput: The first cripple stud next to an opening retains standard geometry.

parameters.name: sAllCripples
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes all cripple studs (short studs filling space above/below openings) from conversion.
parameters.affectsOutput: All cripple studs retain standard geometry.

parameters.name: sKingStud
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes King Studs (full-height studs at the sides of openings) from conversion.

parameters.name: sIgnoreJacks
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes Jack Studs (trimmers supporting headers) from conversion.

parameters.name: sStuds
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes the first and last studs of the wall (the start and end boundary studs) from conversion.
parameters.affectsOutput: The wall's end studs retain standard geometry.

parameters.name: sOpBeams
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes Sills and Transoms (horizontal members at the bottom and top of openings) from conversion.
parameters.affectsOutput: Sills and transoms retain standard geometry.

parameters.name: sHeader
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes Header beams (lintels above openings) from conversion.

parameters.name: sPacker
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', excludes Packer beams (spacers/shims) from conversion.

parameters.name: sbmCode
parameters.businessMeaning: A list of beam codes to explicitly exclude from conversion (e.g., specific material grades or functions).
parameters.affectsOutput: Beams with matching codes are skipped, regardless of their position or type.

parameters.name: dMinLength
parameters.businessMeaning: The minimum length a beam must have to be converted. Beams shorter than this are ignored.
parameters.affectsOutput: Filters out short trim pieces or blocking from conversion.

parameterDependencies.effect: Forces the exclusion of all opening-related members, effectively overriding individual settings.

outputEntities.description: Updates existing Beam entities within the wall to use the specified Extrusion Profile instead of the default rectangular section.
outputEntities.appliedTo: Selected wall elements (ElementWallSF) where beams are not excluded by type, position, length, or code.

workflowDiagram: 1. Script Initialization: Load properties (sProfile, psExtType, etc.) from defaults or catalog settings based on _kExecuteKey.
2. Insertion Check: Determine if script is running in Insert mode (_bOnInsert).
3. Dialog Interaction: If in Insert mode and _kExecuteKey is empty, display the Properties Dialog/OPM for user configuration.
4. Entity Selection: Use PrEntity to prompt user to 'Select a set of elements' (ElementWallSF).
5. Input Parsing: Parse Wall Codes (psExtType) and Beam Codes (sbmCode) into string arrays for filtering.
6. Wall Filtering: Iterate through selected entities, retaining only ElementWallSF objects that match the parsed Wall Codes.
7. Beam Type Classification: Compile an integer array of beam types to exclude (nBmTypeToAvoid) based on property toggles (sTopPlate, sHeader, sAllOpBeams, etc.).
8. Processing Loop: Iterate through each filtered Wall element.
9. Geometry Preparation: Calculate wall coordinate system, envelope, and retrieve all contained beams.
10. Vertical Beam Analysis: Sort beams vertically. If 'Left/Right Studs' (sStuds) is 'Yes', identify and mark the first and last beam handles for exclusion.

11. Cripple Analysis (Conditional): If 'First Cripple' (sCripple) is 'Yes', perform geometric intersection between openings and cripple beams to identify specific cripples adjacent to openings and mark them for exclusion.
12. Beam Conversion Loop: Iterate through all beams in the wall.
13. Exclusion Filtering: Check if the current beam matches a type in nBmTypeToAvoid, is in the manual handle exclusion list, or has a code in the sbmCode exclusion list.
14. Length Filtering: If dMinLength > 0, check if beam length meets the requirement.
15. Apply Profile: If beam passes all filters, apply the Extrusion Profile (sProfile) to the beam.
16. Termination: Set erase flag and call eraseInstance() to remove the script instance from the drawing.

path1.name: Manual Insert
steps: If unique, check if _kExecuteKey is empty.

path2.name: Catalog/Recalc (Not Insert)
steps: Proceed directly to parsing and processing logic.

path1.name: Yes
steps: Add all opening related types (Header, Sill, Transom, Packer, Jacks, Cripples, King Studs) to exclusion list.
Ignore individual opening beam property settings.

path2.name: No
steps: Check individual properties (sHeader, sCripple, sKingStud, etc.).
Add only specific types to exclusion list where properties are set to 'Yes'.

path2.name: Code Not Found
steps: Proceed to Type and Length checks.

validationRules.recovery: User must ensure valid ElementWallSF entities are selected during the PrEntity prompt.
Verify that the 'Code Profile Wall' property (psExtType) matches the code of the wall elements in the drawing (e.g., change default 'I;J;' to match wall codes).
Adjust 'Minimum length of beam' property to a lower value or 0 to include shorter beams.
Ensure the 'Extrusion profile name' (sProfile) exists in the hsbCAD Extrusion Profile catalog.

postInsertionActions.how: Insert script instance again or use catalog entry
postInsertionActions.effect: Re-evaluates walls and beams based on current property settings; resets profiles on beams if filters change.
User can manually change profile or dimensions of individual converted beams.

postInsertionActions.how: Update Wall Element properties and regenerate wall
postInsertionActions.effect: Script would need to be rerun to re-apply profiles to new/modified beams.

data.markdown:
# hsb_ConvertStudsToProfiles.mcr

## Overview
This script allows you to convert standard rectangular studs within selected wall elements into 3D extrusion profiles (such as I-joists or custom timber sections). It provides detailed filtering options to exclude specific components like top plates, opening framing, or beams with specific codes from the conversion.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | This script operates on Wall Elements (`ElementWallSF`) in the model. |
| Paper Space | No | Not designed for layout views or shop drawings. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Not designed for detailing views. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: Wall Elements (`ElementWallSF`) must exist in the drawing and contain beams.
- **Catalog Entries**: An Extrusion Profile (e.g., an I-Joist shape) must exist in the hsbCAD Extrusion Profile catalog to be selected in the properties.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
1.  Type `TSLINSERT` in the AutoCAD command line.
2.  Select `hsb_ConvertStudsToProfiles.mcr` from the file dialog.

### Step 2: Configure Properties
1.  The Properties Palette will appear automatically.
2.  Select the desired **Extrusion profile name** from the dropdown list.
3.  Adjust the **Code Profile Wall** to match the code of the walls you want to process (default is `I;J;`).
4.  Set the various exclusion toggles (e.g., `Top Plate`, `Header`, `Ignore all opening beams`) to `Yes` for any members you **do not** want to convert.

### Step 3: Select Walls
```
Command Line: Select a set of elements
Action: Click on the Wall Elements (ElementWallSF) you wish to modify and press Enter.
```
*Note: Select the wall entity, not the individual beams inside it.*

### Step 4: Execution
The script will process the selected walls, applying the chosen profile to eligible beams and skipping excluded ones. The script instance will then automatically remove itself from the drawing.

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Extrusion profile name | Dropdown | (Catalog List) | Select the 3D extrusion profile (e.g., I-Joist) to apply to the studs. |
| Code Profile Wall | Text | I;J; | The wall code(s) to process. Separate multiple codes with a semicolon (;). |
| Top Plate | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", top plates are excluded and keep their original shape. |
| Bottom Plate | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", bottom plates are excluded and keep their original shape. |
| Blocking | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", blocking members are excluded from conversion. |
| Ignore all opening beams | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", all framing around openings (cripples, jacks, headers, etc.) is excluded. |
| First Cripple | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", excludes the cripple stud immediately adjacent to the opening. |
| All Cripples | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", excludes all cripple studs above/below openings. |
| King Studs | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", excludes king studs (full height studs at opening sides). |
| Jacks Above/Below Opening | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", excludes jack studs (trimmers). |
| Left/Right Studs | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", excludes the first and last studs of the wall (boundary studs). |
| Sill/Transom | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", excludes sills and transoms (horizontal members at openings). |
| Header | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", excludes header beams (lintels above openings). |
| Packer | Dropdown | No | If "Yes", excludes packer beams (spacers). |
| Exclude Beams with Code | Text | (Empty) | Enter beam codes to exclude (e.g., `STD;SPR`). Beams matching these codes will not be converted. |
| Minimum length of beam | Number | 0 | Beams shorter than this length (in project units) will not be converted. |

## Right-Click Menu Options
None. This script executes once and automatically removes itself (`eraseInstance`) from the drawing upon completion. To modify settings, re-insert the script.

## Settings Files
- **Catalog Location**: hsbCAD Catalog database.
- **Purpose**: The script uses the Extrusion Profile catalog to populate the list of available profiles in the Properties Palette.

## Tips
- **Filtering by Wall Code**: If you have both interior and exterior walls, use the `Code Profile Wall` property to target only specific types. Ensure the codes in the property match the codes assigned to your Wall Elements in the drawing.
- **Master Switch for Openings**: Use `Ignore all opening beams` = "Yes" if you want to quickly keep all opening framing (cripples, jacks, headers) as standard solid timber while converting the main wall studs.
- **Short Lengths**: Use `Minimum length of beam` to prevent very small filler pieces or blocking from being converted to complex profiles, which can improve performance and model cleanliness.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why did nothing happen when I ran the script?**
  - A: Check the `Code Profile Wall` property. If the default (`I;J;`) does not match the actual codes of the walls you selected, the script will skip them. Also, ensure you selected Wall Elements (`ElementWallSF`), not individual beams.
- **Q: Can I undo the changes?**
  - A: Yes, use the standard AutoCAD `UNDO` command immediately after running the script if the results are not as expected.
- **Q: How do I convert all beams including plates?**
  - A: Set all exclusion properties (Top Plate, Bottom Plate, Header, etc.) to "No". The script will then attempt to convert every beam found in the wall that matches the length and code filters.
